page.title: 08MRS COOPER (100), KINGSTON
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Daisy Cooper who is a hundred years old. Daisy has lived in{Kingston}for ninety six years and went to the Saint Luke's School when it was first opened. When she a little girl there was no Latchmere School. Latchmere Lane was a real country lane. Near{Ham Common}there was a stile, and Daisy liked going over it and playing near it.Gipsies used to camp by Latchmere Lane. There were market gardens along Richmond Road.She says Kingston has changed so much since she was young that it is quite differrent now.
